Heilbrunn Timeline of Art History: Le Colis de Trianon–Versailles and Paris Openings
Costume in The Metropolitan Museum of Art
Description: Schiaparelli often used her accessories, particularly belts, as avenues of expression for her Surrealist ideals. Buckles, clasps, decorations and belts themselves were made of unusual materials, such as plastic and plaster, and in quirky shapes that could elicit a viewer’s double-take. To pair such an off-beat accessory with a couture garment was just the kind of humorous irony Schiaparelli enjoyed incorporating into her work. This amusing, unconventional belt in classic Schiaparelli Shocking pink, is a humorous play on elastic garters or suspenders. The buckle, two abstract shapes in contrasting colors made of three layers of plastic laminated together, shows Schiaparelli's interest in experimenting with different types of materials.
